config
Class Configuration

java.lang.Object
  config.Configuration

public class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object

Configuration is a singleton design pattern class (no direct instantiation) used for holding configuration information. Code for this found here:

  • http://www.javacoffeebreak.com/articles/designpatterns/index.html
  • http://www.javabeginner.com/learn-java/java-singleton-design-pattern

    • Author:
    Lasse

    Constructor Detail

    Configuration

    private Configuration()
    Make default constructor private to make sure no other class can instantiate. Map information is read from the database taxi id, taxi coordinates and company address is entered and set

    Method Detail

    getConfiguration

    public static Configuration getConfiguration()
    When first called, the getConfigurationmethod creates a singleton instance, assigns it to a member variable, and returns the singleton. Subsequent calls will return the same singleton, and all is well with the world. Method is declared syncronized to prevent two threads from calling the getConfiguration method at the same time.

    Returns:
    configurationObject holds static instance of Configuration object.

    clone

    public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
    We override the inherited superclass implementation of clone() to prevent cloning of the singleton. For now the only superclass is Object, in which clone() is protected, but later on we might inherit from another class that implements clone()

    Overrides:
    clone in class java.lang.Object
    Returns:
    nothing, throws exception
    Throws:
    java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
